oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Strikers demonstrate at Rockwood, Tennessee Hosiery Mills, 1936 April 16
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of a group of strikers at Rockwood Tennessee Hosiery Mills on strike because their work day hours were increased without pay increase. An effort was made on this day to organize a local American Federation of Hosiery Workers. The Nashville Banner reported the news and some alternative photographs about the strikers' demonstration in the April 16, 1936 issue of the newspaper. Forms part of the Nashville Banner Archives. 1 photograph negative : b & w ; 3.25 x 4.25 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Rockwood Hosiery Mills (Tenn.)
